mn100:2.1: Cp. SN 7.1. I have used the same spelling for the name.
mn100:3.5: tata bhadramukha is unique, and I think it is deliberately condescending. “Oh, sweetie!”
mn100:5.5: Text apparently drops extra ti by mistake, it should be “evam bhoti” ti.
mn100:42.5: The idiomatic instrumental thanaso is used in two ways in the suttas: “imediately, on the spot”, and “in terms of cause”, where it is usually paired with hetuso. I take it in the latter sense. The Buddha was phrasing his reply so as to avoid the implied metaphysical absolutism in the question.
